FuncDef:
The display ip routing-table table-name command displays information about a specified IPv4 routing table.
The display ip routing-table vpn-instance command displays information about the routing table of an IPv4 VPN instance. The display ip routing-table table-name command displays information about a specified IPv4 routing table. The display ip routing-table vpn-instance command displays information about the routing table of an IPv4 VPN instance.
CLIs: display ip routing-table table-name msr [ time-range <min-age> <max-age> ]
display ip routing-table vpn-instance <vpn-instance-name> protocol { bgp | direct | isis | rip | static | ospf } { verbose | inactive }

ParaDef.Info:
Displays information about the routing table of an IPv4 address family-enabled VPN instance.
The value is a string of 1 to 31 case-sensitive characters, spaces not supported. In addition, the VPN instance name must not be _public_. When double quotation marks are used around the string, spaces are allowed in the string.

Specifies the name of a routing table.
-

Displays information about the multicast static routing table.
-

Displays information about a route to a specified IP destination address.
The value is in dotted decimal notation.

Specifies mask.
The mask is in dotted decimal notation.

Specifies the length of the mask.
The value is an integer ranging from 0 to 32.

Displays detailed information about active and inactive routes.
-

Displays routes of a specified protocol.
-

Displays the summary of inactive routes only.
-

Displays routes that are generated within a specified period.
-

Specifies the start generation time.
The value is a string of characters, in the format of XXdXXhXXmXXs.

Specifies the end generation time.
The value is a string of characters, in the format of XXdXXhXXmXXs.

Examples: <HUAWEI> display ip routing-table vpn-instance vpna 10.34.34.3 verbose
